cards.name: Abrupt Decay
cards.text:
Abrupt Decay can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Destroy target nonland permanent with converted mana cost 3 or less.
cards.flavor: The Izzet quickly suspended their policy of lifetime guarantees.

cards.name: Aerial Predation
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: In the towering trees of the Samok Stand and the predators that guard them, the might of the Ravnican wild has returned.

cards.name: Angel of Serenity
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Serenity enters the battlefield, you may exile up to three other target creatures from the battlefield and/or creature cards from graveyards.
When Angel of Serenity leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Annihilating Fire
cards.text: Annihilating Fire deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor:
"The most impressive performances can be done only once."
—Mote, Rakdos madcap

cards.name: Aquus Steed
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In water, it's as graceful as a dolphin. On land, it darts and jerks so unpredictably that few can ride it for long.

cards.name: Archon of the Triumvirate
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Archon of the Triumvirate attacks, detain up to two target nonland permanents your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those permanents can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Archweaver
cards.text: Reach, trample
cards.flavor: The silk of the archweavers adds structural integrity to otherwise unstable Izzet building sites.

cards.name: Armada Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Armada Wurm enters the battlefield, put a 5/5 green Wurm creature token with trample onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: No one in the Conclave acts alone.

cards.name: Armory Guard
cards.text: Armory Guard has vigilance as long as you control a Gate.
cards.flavor: The Dimir agents watched from the shadows. "Eight hours, and I've yet to see him blink," Nefara hissed. "I suggest we find another way in."

cards.name: Arrest
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
"We will prove your guilt. We don't arrest the innocent, you know."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

cards.name: Ash Zealot
cards.text:
First strike, haste
Whenever a player casts a spell from a graveyard, Ash Zealot deals 3 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: "Smarter than death? Let's see you outsmart my mace, necromancer!"

cards.name: Assassin's Strike
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its controller discards a card.
cards.flavor: When Selesnya missionaries moved into the Shanav Quarter, they faced scorn, ridicule, and ultimately martyrdom.

cards.name: Auger Spree
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/-4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Finally, a weapon the Boros can't confiscate!"
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue

cards.name: Avenging Arrow
cards.text: Destroy target creature that dealt damage this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Forgive the theft. Punish the deception."
—Alcarus, Selesnya archer

cards.name: Axebane Guardian
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Add X mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool, where X is the number of creatures with defender you control.
cards.flavor: Only a worthy few are permitted within the sentient forest known as Axebane.

cards.name: Axebane Stag
cards.flavor:
"When the spires have burned and the cobblestones are dust, he will take his rightful place as king of the wilds."
—Kirce, Axebane guardian

cards.name: Azor's Elocutors
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a filibuster counter on Azor's Elocutors. Then if Azor's Elocutors has five or more filibuster counters on it, you win the game.
Whenever a source deals damage to you, remove a filibuster counter from Azor's Elocutors.

cards.name: Azorius Arrester
cards.text: When Azorius Arrester enters the battlefield, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)
cards.flavor: "You have the right to remain silent. Mostly because I tire of your excuses."

cards.name: Azorius Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn.
• Draw a card.
• Put target attacking or blocking creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"The rules of logic and order have already made the choice for you."
—Isperia

cards.name: Azorius Guildgate
cards.text:
Azorius Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter the Senate, the seat of justice and the foundation of Ravnican society.

cards.name: Azorius Justiciar
cards.text: When Azorius Justiciar enters the battlefield, detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)
cards.flavor: "Your potential to commit a crime warrants further investigation."

cards.name: Azorius Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}: Azorius Keyrune becomes a 2/2 white and blue Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The higher the mind soars, the greater its understanding of the law."
—Isperia

cards.name: Batterhorn
cards.text: When Batterhorn enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Novice shopkeeps spend hours deciding how best to display their wares. Veterans focus on portability.

cards.name: Bazaar Krovod
cards.text: Whenever Bazaar Krovod attacks, another target attacking creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
cards.flavor: The Hauler's Collective wields great influence over the Ravnican merchant class. Without it, little moves in the city.

cards.name: Bellows Lizard
cards.text: {1}{R}: Bellows Lizard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As the price of wood and coal rose, smiths found creative ways to keep their forges burning.

cards.name: Blistercoil Weird
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Blistercoil Weird gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Untap it.
cards.flavor: Azorius lawmages would like to outlaw the creation of weirds, but first they'd have to settle their long-standing debate on how to classify them.

cards.name: Blood Crypt
cards.text:
({T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.)
As Blood Crypt enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Blood Crypt enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Where the dead serve as diversion, decor, and dessert.

cards.name: Bloodfray Giant
cards.text:
Trample
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: The star performer of the Juri Revue, his shows have fans and blood spilling into the street.

cards.name: Blustersquall
cards.text:
Tap target creature you don't control.
Overload {3}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
cards.flavor: Weather is more predictable than the Izzet.

cards.name: Brushstrider
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Magistrate Ludy agreed to designate land for the brushstriders only after several broken windows and dozens of missing blini-cakes.

cards.name: Call of the Conclave
cards.text: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Centaurs are sent to evangelize in Gruul territories where words of war speak louder than prayers of peace.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor:
"It is forbidden. Asking why is irrelevant."
—Sergiu, Opal Lake magistrate

cards.name: Carnival Hellsteed
cards.text:
First strike, haste
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: Its favorite treats are candied hands and sweet hearts.

cards.name: Catacomb Slug
cards.flavor:
"The entire murder scene was covered in dripping, oozing slime. No need for a soothsayer to solve that one."
—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator

cards.name: Centaur Healer
cards.text: When Centaur Healer enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Instructors at the Kasarna training grounds are capable healers in case their students fail to grasp the subtleties of combat.

cards.name: Centaur's Herald
cards.text: {2}{G}, Sacrifice Centaur's Herald: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The farther they go from Vitu-Ghazi, the less willing the crowd is to part for them.

cards.name: Chaos Imps
cards.text:
Flying
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Chaos Imps has trample as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Chemister's Trick
cards.text:
Target creature you don't control gets -2/-0 until end of turn and attacks this turn if able.
Overload {3}{U}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Chorus of Might
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control and gains trample.
cards.flavor:
"In each of us is the strength of all of us."
—Trostani

cards.name: Chromatic Lantern
cards.text:
Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Dimir mages put the lanterns to good use, creating shapeshifters and sleeper agents from mana foreign to them.

cards.name: Chronic Flooding
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, its controller puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: With the Izzet occupied elsewhere, many of their public works fell into disrepair.

cards.name: Civic Saber
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each of its colors.
Equip {1}
cards.flavor: Those without a guild signet often display a different form of protection.

cards.name: Cobblebrute
cards.flavor: The most ancient streets take on a life of their own. A few have decided to move to nicer neighborhoods.

cards.name: Codex Shredder
cards.text:
{T}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Codex Shredder: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Collective Blessing
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Senators of Azorius often hired agents to spy on the Selesnya. They were told to record every spore and root they saw, as each could become a deadly foe.

cards.name: Common Bond
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: Wolf riders hone their skills traversing the perilous rooftops, each dizzying step bringing elf and wolf closer together.

cards.name: Concordia Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"A kick from its hooves is like a bolt of lightning. I'd know. I've been hit by both."
—Rencz, Izzet chemister's aide

cards.name: Conjured Currency
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exchange control of Conjured Currency and target permanent you neither own nor control.
cards.flavor: A bargain in Keyhole Downs is always too good to be true.

cards.name: Corpsejack Menace
cards.text: If one or more +1/+1 counters would be placed on a creature you control, twice that many +1/+1 counters are placed on it instead.
cards.flavor: Weakness is not in the nature of the Swarm.

cards.name: Counterflux
cards.text:
Counterflux can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Counter target spell you don't control.
Overload {1}{U}{U}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Coursers' Accord
cards.text: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token onto the battlefield, then populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor: Bleak rumors reached Trostani's ears. She decreed that no one should travel alone.

cards.name: Cremate
cards.text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Without a body, the soul is helpless to fight the terms of our contracts."
—Somhaur, Orzhov pontiff

cards.name: Crosstown Courier
cards.text: Whenever Crosstown Courier deals combat damage to a player, that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: Information travels quickly through Ravnica's network of messengers and thought agents.

cards.name: Cryptborn Horror
cards.text:
Trample
Cryptborn Horror enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the total life lost by your opponents this turn.
cards.flavor: Although Cryptwitch Merree vanished after a spat with Rakdos, her playthings lingered.

cards.name: Cyclonic Rift
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent you don't control to its owner's hand.
Overload {6}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
cards.flavor: The Izzet specialize in unnatural disaster.

cards.name: Daggerdrome Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: One of the many reasons why open-air markets close at dusk.

cards.name: Dark Revenant
cards.text:
Flying
When Dark Revenant dies, put it on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The murderer faced justice in the Azorius courts, but his soul was set free on a technicality.

cards.name: Dead Reveler
cards.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: He's the unlife of the party.

cards.name: Deadbridge Goliath
cards.text: Scavenge {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Some Golgari insects live for centuries—and they never stop growing.

cards.name: Death's Presence
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, put X +1/+1 counters on target creature you control, where X is the power of the creature that died.
cards.flavor:
"We traffic in flesh, not souls. Still, it's a shame to let anything go to waste."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

cards.name: Deathrite Shaman
cards.text:
{T}: Exile target land card from a graveyard. Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{B}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from a graveyard. Each opponent loses 2 life.
{G}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Desecration Demon
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each combat, any opponent may sacrifice a creature. If a player does, tap Desecration Demon and put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Destroy the Evidence
cards.text: Destroy target land. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: Everyone knew the Dimir had done the damage. Everyone suspected the Izzet had hired them.

cards.name: Detention Sphere
cards.text:
When Detention Sphere enters the battlefield, you may exile target nonland permanent not named Detention Sphere and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent.
When Detention Sphere leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.

cards.name: Deviant Glee
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has "{R}: This creature gains trample until end of turn."
cards.flavor: "You just need the right incentive to fulfill my dreams."

cards.name: Dispel
cards.text: Counter target instant spell.
cards.flavor:
"Civilization will subsume us unless we overwhelm it instead."
—Speaker Zegana

cards.name: Doorkeeper
cards.text:
Defender
{2}{U}, {T}: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of creatures with defender you control.
cards.flavor: One piercing stare usually convinces thieves to go elsewhere.

cards.name: Downsize
cards.text:
Target creature you don't control gets -4/-0 until end of turn.
Overload {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Drainpipe Vermin
cards.text: When Drainpipe Vermin dies, you may pay {B}. If you do, target player discards a card.
cards.flavor: When times are tough, the poor eat the rats. When times are tougher, the rats eat the poor.

cards.name: Dramatic Rescue
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I never thought I'd be so glad to see two tons of beak and claws bearing down on me at the speed of an arrow."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

cards.name: Dreadbore
cards.text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: In Rakdos-controlled neighborhoods, everyone is part of the show.

cards.name: Dreg Mangler
cards.text:
Haste
Scavenge {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Drudge Beetle
cards.text: Scavenge {5}{G} ({5}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: The Street Swarm is the labor class that drives the Golgari's endless cycle of life and death.

cards.name: Druid's Deliverance
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn. Populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor: "So many oppose us, but we are the reed that bends without breaking."

cards.name: Dryad Militant
cards.text: If an instant or sorcery card would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: "We will defend the Worldsoul from Izzet ‘progress' at any cost."

cards.name: Dynacharge
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Overload {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
cards.flavor: Nothing evens the odds like a little lightning.

cards.name: Electrickery
cards.text:
Electrickery deals 1 damage to target creature you don't control.
Overload {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Epic Experiment
cards.text: Exile the top X cards of your library. For each instant and sorcery card with converted mana cost X or less among them, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then put all cards exiled this way that weren't cast into your graveyard.

cards.name: Essence Backlash
cards.text: Counter target creature spell. Essence Backlash deals damage equal to that spell's power to its controller.
cards.flavor:
"The other guilds will learn the hard way not to interfere with our investigations."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

cards.name: Ethereal Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control and has first strike.
cards.flavor: Metal is scarce, smiths are pricey, and plate mail is heavy.

cards.name: Explosive Impact
cards.text: Explosive Impact deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Such boorish noise is what passes for subtlety among the Boros."
—Vraska

cards.name: Eyes in the Skies
cards.text: Put a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield, then populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor:
"What root and branch cannot reach, our winged friends will attend to."
—Zunak, Selesnya strategist

cards.name: Faerie Impostor
cards.text:
Flying
When Faerie Impostor enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return another creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Many Tin Street shops display a sign on the door: "No cloaks allowed."

cards.name: Fall of the Gavel
cards.text: Counter target spell. You gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: "My ruling is final. Order is upheld. Justice is done."

cards.name: Fencing Ace
cards.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor: His prowess gives the guildless hope that they can hold out against tyranny.

cards.name: Firemind's Foresight
cards.text: Search your library for an instant card with converted mana cost 3, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then repeat this process for instant cards with converted mana costs 2 and 1. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Frostburn Weird
cards.text: {U/R}: Frostburn Weird gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Many chemisters are oblivious to the innumerable machinations of their guild, instead focusing obsessively on creating the perfect weird.

cards.name: Gatecreeper Vine
cards.text:
Defender
When Gatecreeper Vine enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card or a Gate card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every inch of Ravnica is home to something.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The prohibition of unnecessary tossing of the citizenry by giants shall also extend to spontaneous giants."
—Isperia's Edict, provision VII.789.2

cards.name: Gobbling Ooze
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Gobbling Ooze.
cards.flavor: The furious citizens blamed the Simic for releasing it in their district. The Simic pointed out that rats were no longer a problem.

cards.name: Goblin Electromancer
cards.text: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: When asked how much power is required, Izzet mages always answer "more."

cards.name: Goblin Rally
cards.text: Put four 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: You don't so much hire goblins as put ideas in their heads.

cards.name: Golgari Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"Let the rest of Ravnica sneer. One way or another, they all end up in the undercity."
—Jarad

cards.name: Golgari Decoy
cards.text:
All creatures able to block Golgari Decoy do so.
Scavenge {3}{G}{G} ({3}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Golgari Guildgate
cards.text:
Golgari Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter those who are starving and sick. You are welcome among the Swarm when the rest of Ravnica rejects you.

cards.name: Golgari Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
{B}{G}: Golgari Keyrune becomes a 2/2 black and green Insect artifact creature with deathtouch until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Like a single ant, it only hints at the colony below.

cards.name: Golgari Longlegs
cards.flavor: Despite its enormous stature, it can fold itself into a tunnel with startling quickness, vanishing back into the undercity.

cards.name: Gore-House Chainwalker
cards.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: If the pig's blood drips on you, you're next on the chain.

cards.name: Grave Betrayal
cards.text: Whenever a creature you don't control dies, return it to the battlefield under your control with an additional +1/+1 counter on it at the beginning of the next end step. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Grim Roustabout
cards.text:
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Grim Roustabout.
cards.flavor: He'll point you to your death row seats.

cards.name: Grisly Salvage
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: To the Golgari, anything buried is treasure.

cards.name: Grove of the Guardian
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}{G}{W}, {T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control, Sacrifice Grove of the Guardian: Put an 8/8 green and white Elemental creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Growing Ranks
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor:
"We will grow an army large enough to withstand the Izzet's madness."
—Trostani

cards.name: Guild Feud
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent reveals the top three cards of his or her library, may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield, then puts the rest into his or her graveyard. You do the same with the top three cards of your library. If two creatures are put onto the battlefield this way, those creatures fight each other.

cards.name: Guttersnipe
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: He wants to watch Ravnica burn, one soul at a time.

cards.name: Hallowed Fountain
cards.text:
({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)
As Hallowed Fountain enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Hallowed Fountain enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: A place to relax, if you have the proper permit.

cards.name: Havoc Festival
cards.text:
Players can't gain life.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses half his or her life, rounded up.
cards.flavor:
"We can't control enemies who have no regard for their own survival."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

cards.name: Hellhole Flailer
cards.text:
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{2}{B}{R}, Sacrifice Hellhole Flailer: Hellhole Flailer deals damage equal to its power to target player.

cards.name: Heroes' Reunion
cards.text: Target player gains 7 life.
cards.flavor: They share no bloodline, but a bond greater than family unites them. Such are the gifts of the Worldsoul.

cards.name: Horncaller's Chant
cards.text: Put a 4/4 green Rhino creature token with trample onto the battlefield, then populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor:
"The Selesnya are gathering armies. Do you still believe they aren't preparing for war?"
—Teysa, to Isperia

cards.name: Hover Barrier
cards.text: Defender, flying
cards.flavor: As whispers and rumors increased, so did the demand for fail-safe barriers.

cards.name: Hussar Patrol
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Vigilance
cards.flavor:
"You think no one is watching, you think you're smart enough to escape, and most foolish of all, you think no one cares."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

cards.name: Hypersonic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying, haste
You may cast sorcery cards as though they had flash. (You may cast them any time you could cast an instant.)
cards.flavor:
"Even this primitive specimen of my kind is impressive."
—Niv-Mizzet

cards.name: Inaction Injunction
cards.text:
Detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"To prevent action is to prevent transgression."
—Azorius Arrester motto

cards.name: Inspiration
cards.text: Target player draws two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Day 31: I finally succeeded in my time reversal experiment!
"Day 30: I might have a problem here."
—Journal of the Prime Izmagnus

cards.name: Isperia's Skywatch
cards.text:
Flying
When Isperia's Skywatch enters the battlefield, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Isperia, Supreme Judge
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I serve only justice. But through that duty, I serve all of Ravnica."

cards.name: Izzet Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.
• Izzet Charm deals 2 damage to target creature.
• Draw two cards, then discard two cards.

cards.name: Izzet Guildgate
cards.text:
Izzet Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter those with the vision to create and the daring to release their creations.

cards.name: Izzet Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.
{U}{R}: Until end of turn, Izzet Keyrune becomes a 2/1 blue and red Elemental artifact creature.
Whenever Izzet Keyrune deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.name: Izzet Staticaster
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Haste
{T}: Izzet Staticaster deals 1 damage to target creature and each other creature with the same name as that creature.

cards.name: Jace, Architect of Thought
cards.text:
+1: Until your next turn, whenever a creature an opponent controls attacks, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
−2: Reveal the top three cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library in any order.
−8: For each player, search that player's library for a nonland card and exile it, then that player shuffles his or her library. You may cast those cards without paying their mana costs.

cards.name: Jarad's Orders
cards.text: Search your library for up to two creature cards and reveal them. Put one into your hand and the other into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "The Izzet are searching for something. Discern what or die trying."

cards.name: Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord
cards.text:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Judge's Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Judge's Familiar: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor:
"It misses nothing and it has no sense of humor."
—Barvisa, courtroom scribe

cards.name: Keening Apparition
cards.text: Sacrifice Keening Apparition: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Some souls are too damaged to be of use to the Orzhov.

cards.name: Knightly Valor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Knightly Valor enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance.

cards.name: Korozda Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn.
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Korozda Monitor
cards.text:
Trample
Scavenge {5}{G}{G} ({5}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Launch Party
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Launch Party, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Life's too short to not do the things you love.

cards.name: Lobber Crew
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Lobber Crew deals 1 damage to each opponent.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, untap Lobber Crew.
cards.flavor: It's easier to just aim at everything.

cards.name: Lotleth Troll
cards.text:
Trample
Discard a creature card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Lotleth Troll.
{B}: Regenerate Lotleth Troll.
cards.flavor: He lurks in the undercity, eager for the corpse haulers to unload their rotting cargo.

cards.name: Loxodon Smiter
cards.text:
Loxodon Smiter can't be countered.
If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Loxodon Smiter, put it onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Lyev Skyknight
cards.text:
Flying
When Lyev Skyknight enters the battlefield, detain target nonland permanent an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that permanent can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Mana Bloom
cards.text:
Mana Bloom enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Bloom: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Mana Bloom has no charge counters on it, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Martial Law
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)
cards.flavor:
"The good of society matters much more than the inconvenience of a few."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

cards.name: Mercurial Chemister
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Draw two cards.
{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Mercurial Chemister deals damage to target creature equal to the discarded card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: What some see as "distracted" is really "fathoming the unfathomable."

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: With no memories left to compare to his present situation, Andalum was finally content.

cards.name: Minotaur Aggressor
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor: The smelting district is home to many who see the guilds as not for them.

cards.name: Mizzium Mortars
cards.text:
Mizzium Mortars deals 4 damage to target creature you don't control.
Overload {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Mizzium Skin
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +0/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn.
Overload {1}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Necropolis Regent
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put that many +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: "Jarad fancies himself king of the undercity, but he's merely king of rot."

cards.name: New Prahv Guildmage
cards.text:
{W}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
{3}{W}{U}: Detain target nonland permanent an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that permanent can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius deals damage to a player, you may draw a card.
{U}{R}: Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: He has no patience for minds that do not inspire him or explode by trying.

cards.name: Nivix Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{U}{R}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
{2}{U}{R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: "The only action worth taking is one with an unknown outcome."

cards.name: Nivmagus Elemental
cards.text: Exile an instant or sorcery spell you control: Put two +1/+1 counters on Nivmagus Elemental. (That spell won't resolve.)
cards.flavor: When it escaped, the experimenters hesitated. It would cause untold havoc, yet they wished to see it in action.

cards.name: Oak Street Innkeeper
cards.text: As long as it's not your turn, tapped creatures you control have hexproof.
cards.flavor: The city is vast and perilous, but there are places where a weary traveler can feel very much at home.

cards.name: Ogre Jailbreaker
cards.text:
Defender
Ogre Jailbreaker can attack as though it didn't have defender as long as you control a Gate.
cards.flavor: It took three years for it to occur to him to use the chain as a weapon, but once it did, he made up for lost time.

cards.name: Overgrown Tomb
cards.text:
({T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.)
As Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: The best funeral shroud is the fabric of new life.

cards.name: Pack Rat
cards.text:
Pack Rat's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Rats you control.
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of Pack Rat.

cards.name: Palisade Giant
cards.text: All damage that would be dealt to you or another permanent you control is dealt to Palisade Giant instead.
cards.flavor: Refusing guild allegiances, she fights for those who can't protect themselves.

cards.name: Paralyzing Grasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"Obviously, the Firemind's mission is worth more than a few goblins."
—Pelener, chamberlain of Niv-Mizzet

cards.name: Perilous Shadow
cards.text: {1}{B}: Perilous Shadow gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There are some shadows that even the Dimir fear.

cards.name: Phantom General
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: After his death, the general was reunited with fallen soldiers from over thirty of his campaigns.

cards.name: Pithing Needle
cards.text:
As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, name a card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.
cards.flavor: The fearful want the procedure before a blood festival. The guilty seek it afterward.

cards.name: Precinct Captain
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."

cards.name: Psychic Spiral
cards.text: Shuffle all cards from your graveyard into your library. Target player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: An elocutor forces criminals to confess to the laws they merely intended to break.

cards.name: Pursuit of Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{U}: This creature gains flying until end of turn."
cards.flavor:
"Watch the voltage. We don't need another charred, crashing viashino."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

cards.name: Pyroconvergence
cards.text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Pyroconvergence deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"The Izzet are an equation that turns lunacy into explosions."
—Leonos, Azorius arbiter

cards.name: Racecourse Fury
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn."
cards.flavor: Close finishes are settled by who can dismount and get to weapons first.

cards.name: Rakdos Cackler
cards.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: Devil-blades and dripping blood make music Rakdos never tires of hearing.

cards.name: Rakdos Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
• Destroy target artifact.
• Each creature deals 1 damage to its controller.
cards.flavor:
"Let all feel joy in pain."
—Rakdos

cards.name: Rakdos Guildgate
cards.text:
Rakdos Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter and indulge your darkest fantasies, for you may never pass this way again.

cards.name: Rakdos Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
{B}{R}: Rakdos Keyrune becomes a 3/1 black and red Devil artifact creature with first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Rakdos use it for everything you can think of and plenty more than that.

cards.name: Rakdos Ragemutt
cards.text: Lifelink, haste
cards.flavor: Ragemutts pull the chariots of the Butcher Clowns, a trio of wingless, zombified faeries formerly of the Izzet.

cards.name: Rakdos Ringleader
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Rakdos Ringleader deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card at random.
{B}: Regenerate Rakdos Ringleader.

cards.name: Rakdos Shred-Freak
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: "If there were such a thing as a soul, I think it would be behind the gallbladder but above the kidneys."

cards.name: Rakdos's Return
cards.text: Rakdos's Return deals X damage to target opponent. That player discards X cards.
cards.flavor: When Lord Rakdos stirred from his slumber, everyone else's nightmare began.

cards.name: Rakdos, Lord of Riots
cards.text:
You can't cast Rakdos, Lord of Riots unless an opponent lost life this turn.
Flying, trample
Creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each 1 life your opponents have lost this turn.

cards.name: Rest in Peace
cards.text:
When Rest in Peace enters the battlefield, exile all cards from all graveyards.
If a card or token would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: Some corpses the Golgari cannot claim. Some souls the Orzhov cannot shackle.

cards.name: Righteous Authority
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each card in its controller's hand.
At the beginning of the draw step of enchanted creature's controller, that player draws an additional card.

cards.name: Risen Sanctuary
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: When one of the great guardians arises, it sweeps enemies aside like chaff yet takes care not to crush a single insect underfoot.

cards.name: Rites of Reaping
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Don't cross a Devkarin elf unless you long for an early grave.

cards.name: Rix Maadi Guildmage
cards.text:
{B}{R}: Target blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{B}{R}: Target player who lost life this turn loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Insatiable, irresistible, and insane.

cards.name: Rogue's Passage
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: Rumors quickly spread among thieves about a labyrinth without walls and a prize beyond all measures of worth.

cards.name: Rootborn Defenses
cards.text: Populate. Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn. (To populate, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control. Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy creatures with indestructible.)

cards.name: Rubbleback Rhino
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: The trouble started when a street urchin bet a goblin he could ride one until the clock on Shilbo's Tower struck thirteen.

cards.name: Runewing
cards.text:
Flying
When Runewing dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: In the hands of the open-minded, a runewing quill writes wisdom of its own.

cards.name: Savage Surge
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
cards.flavor: Gruul warriors never need to be stirred to battle. They need only to be shown where the battle is.

cards.name: Search the City
cards.text:
When Search the City enters the battlefield, exile the top five cards of your library.
Whenever you play a card with the same name as one of the exiled cards, you may put one of those cards with that name into its owner's hand. Then if there are no cards exiled with Search the City, sacrifice it. If you do, take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Search Warrant
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You gain life equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: "And would you care to explain why your satchel is radiating an aura of unstable energy?"

cards.name: Security Blockade
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Security Blockade enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn."

cards.name: Seek the Horizon
cards.text: Search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Raked by vertical spikes of glass and stone, Ravnica's vistas offer only a rare glimpse of the horizon.

cards.name: Selesnya Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Exile target creature with power 5 or greater.
• Put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Selesnya Guildgate
cards.text:
Selesnya Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Enter and rejoice! The Conclave stands united, open to one and all.

cards.name: Selesnya Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
{G}{W}: Selesnya Keyrune becomes a 3/3 green and white Wolf artifact creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A mark of unity when you want one; a fierce guardian when you need one.

cards.name: Selesnya Sentry
cards.text: {5}{G}: Regenerate Selesnya Sentry.
cards.flavor: Ravnicans still tell tales about the Battle of Sumala where four Selesnya sentries held off an entire clan of Gruul warriors.

cards.name: Seller of Songbirds
cards.text: When Seller of Songbirds enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Lady Wren is the one merchant in Keyhole Downs who isn't running a scam."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

cards.name: Sewer Shambler
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Scavenge {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Shrieking Affliction
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has one or fewer cards in hand, he or she loses 3 life.
cards.flavor: A gargoyle's voice reaches pitches that will shatter glass and warp bone.

cards.name: Skull Rend
cards.text: Skull Rend deals 2 damage to each opponent. Those players each discard two cards at random.
cards.flavor:
"We could never accept anyone with a face that pretty or a mind that sane."
—Nyoser, Gore-House ringleader

cards.name: Skyline Predator
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
cards.flavor:
"It will dodge your first arrow and flatten you before there's a second."
—Alcarus, Selesnya archer

cards.name: Skymark Roc
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Skymark Roc attacks, you may return target creature defending player controls with toughness 2 or less to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Try not to look guilty. Or delicious."
—Thorpe, street urchin

cards.name: Slaughter Games
cards.text:
Slaughter Games can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Name a nonland card. Search target opponent's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Slime Molding
cards.text: Put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Give me enough refuse and mana and I will summon an ooze that can engulf all of Ravnica."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

cards.name: Slitherhead
cards.text: Scavenge {0} ({0}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
"It makes better use of Uncle Dragi's head than he ever did."
—Pesha, retired blacksmith

cards.name: Sluiceway Scorpion
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Scavenge {1}{B}{G} ({1}{B}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Slum Reaper
cards.text: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: It's sent into unguilded districts by the Orzhov to collect the souls of those no one will miss.

cards.name: Soul Tithe
cards.text:
Enchant nonland permanent
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted permanent's controller, that player sacrifices it unless he or she pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Soulsworn Spirit
cards.text:
Soulsworn Spirit can't be blocked.
When Soulsworn Spirit enters the battlefield, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Spawn of Rix Maadi
cards.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor:
"Straight from the blood-drenched imagination of our illustrious parun!"
—Nyoser, Gore-House ringleader

cards.name: Sphere of Safety
cards.text: Creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {X} for each of those creatures, where X is the number of enchantments you control.
cards.flavor: The Rakdos believe that all are eager to join their revels, even when told otherwise.

cards.name: Sphinx of the Chimes
cards.text:
Flying
Discard two nonland cards with the same name: Draw four cards.
cards.flavor: "I've dreamt of the future, Isperia. Danger is on the horizon. You must heed my warning."

cards.name: Sphinx's Revelation
cards.text: You gain X life and draw X cards.
cards.flavor: "Let the knowledge of absolute law inspire you to live a life of absolute order."

cards.name: Splatter Thug
cards.text:
First strike
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: The mask isn't meant to hide his identity. It's meant to keep the viscera out of his eyes.

cards.name: Stab Wound
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Stealer of Secrets
cards.text: Whenever Stealer of Secrets deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
cards.flavor: The Dimir would hire her, if only they knew where she lived. The Azorius would condemn her, if only they knew her name.

cards.name: Steam Vents
cards.text:
({T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.)
As Steam Vents enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Steam Vents enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Crafted with genius, energized with madness.

cards.name: Stonefare Crocodile
cards.text: {2}{B}: Stonefare Crocodile gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: The Izzet's plans to exploit the undercity ran into a few stubborn obstacles.

cards.name: Street Spasm
cards.text:
Street Spasm deals X damage to target creature without flying you don't control.
Overload {X}{X}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Street Sweeper
cards.text: Whenever Street Sweeper attacks, destroy all Auras attached to target land.
cards.flavor: The sweepers roam endlessly, scrubbing away the refuse—and anything else too slow or too clumsy to get out of their way.

cards.name: Sundering Growth
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment, then populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor:
"One day every pillar will be a tree and every hall a glade."
—Trostani

cards.name: Sunspire Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"For each griffin wounded by an arrow, there's a corpse with a bow nearby."
—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator

cards.name: Supreme Verdict
cards.text:
Supreme Verdict can't be countered.
Destroy all creatures.
cards.flavor: Leonos had no second thoughts about the abolishment edict. He'd left skyrunes warning of the eviction, even though it was cloudy.

cards.name: Survey the Wreckage
cards.text: Destroy target land. Put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Goblins and architects seldom get along.

cards.name: Swift Justice
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike and lifelink.
cards.flavor:
"Having conviction is more important than being righteous."
—Aurelia

cards.name: Syncopate
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Patience, mage. Killing you now would be too easy."

cards.name: Tablet of the Guilds
cards.text:
As Tablet of the Guilds enters the battlefield, choose two colors.
Whenever you cast a spell, if it's at least one of the chosen colors, you gain 1 life for each of the chosen colors it is.
cards.flavor: It is rumored the Azorius paid an exorbitant sum to ensure its symbol would appear at the top.

cards.name: Tavern Swindler
cards.text: {T}, Pay 3 life: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 6 life.
cards.flavor: Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.

cards.name: Teleportal
cards.text:
Target creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
Overload {3}{U}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Temple Garden
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)
As Temple Garden enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Temple Garden enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: In the gardens of the Conclave, order and beauty are the roots of power.

cards.name: Tenement Crasher
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: Nothing was going to stop it—not the narrow alleys, not the Boros garrison, and certainly not the four-story Orzhov cathedral.

cards.name: Terrus Wurm
cards.text: Scavenge {6}{B} ({6}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
"We follow it through its tunnels, and where it dies, we farm."
—Mihas, spore druid

cards.name: Thoughtflare
cards.text: Draw four cards, then discard two cards.
cards.flavor: "If this is thinking, I don't know what I was doing before."

cards.name: Thrill-Kill Assassin
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: As the bounty on Massacre Girl rose, so did the number of imitators.

cards.name: Tower Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{W}: Tower Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The first motion put forth in the pristine Jelenn Column was for severe restrictions on the airspace around New Prahv.

cards.name: Towering Indrik
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It chases its airborne prey relentlessly, heedless to what it pulverizes beneath its hooves.

cards.name: Trained Caracal
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Some Ravnicans consider carrying a sword to be beneath them, preferring instead a tooth-and-claw escort.

cards.name: Traitorous Instinct
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. Until end of turn, it gets +2/+0 and gains haste.
cards.flavor: Joining the Worldsoul took years of study and meditation. Severing that connection took the snap of Rakdos's fingers.

cards.name: Transguild Promenade
cards.text:
Transguild Promenade enters the battlefield tapped.
When Transguild Promenade enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Treasured Find
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Treasured Find.
cards.flavor: Gorgons crave beautiful things: gems, exquisite amulets, the alabaster corpses of the petrified dead . . .

cards.name: Trestle Troll
cards.text:
Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{B}{G}: Regenerate Trestle Troll.
cards.flavor: Unwelcome in Golgari colonies, he found his own dark place from which to represent the Swarm.

cards.name: Trostani's Judgment
cards.text: Exile target creature, then populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor:
"Some cannot be saved as they are, but all can serve the Worldsoul."
—Trostani

cards.name: Trostani, Selesnya's Voice
cards.text:
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
{1}{G}{W}, {T}: Populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

cards.name: Ultimate Price
cards.text: Destroy target monocolored creature.
cards.flavor:
"Let him be an example to others who would default on their debts to us."
—"The Cozen," Orzhov assassin

cards.name: Underworld Connections
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Pay 1 life: Draw a card."
cards.flavor: If you're looking for it, it's available. The question is how much you're willing to pay.

cards.name: Urban Burgeoning
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "Untap this land during each other player's untap step."
cards.flavor: The ruins of Old Prahv became a wildspace, although all birdsong was silenced by lingering Azorius magic.

cards.name: Utvara Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, put a 6/6 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The fear of dragons is as old and as powerful as the fear of death itself.

cards.name: Vandalblast
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact you don't control.
Overload {4}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")
cards.flavor: Beauty is in the eye of the exploder.

cards.name: Vassal Soul
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: For the Azorius, the opportunity to serve the law is too great an honor for death to interrupt.

cards.name: Viashino Racketeer
cards.text: When Viashino Racketeer enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "You may call me a fool, selling this stuff on Orzhov turf. Well, you need to be a little reckless to survive."

cards.name: Vitu-Ghazi Guildmage
cards.text:
{4}{G}{W}: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token onto the battlefield.
{2}{G}{W}: Populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor: "Preachers of freedom forget that conformity can be beautiful."

cards.name: Voidwielder
cards.text: When Voidwielder enters the battlefield, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"He makes up his own laws, and that's dangerous to all who love peace and prosperity. Kill him on sight."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

cards.name: Volatile Rig
cards.text:
Trample
Volatile Rig attacks each turn if able.
Whenever Volatile Rig is dealt damage, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Volatile Rig.
When Volatile Rig dies, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, it deals 4 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Vraska the Unseen
cards.text:
+1: Until your next turn, whenever a creature deals combat damage to Vraska the Unseen, destroy that creature.
−3: Destroy target nonland permanent.
−7: Put three 1/1 black Assassin creature tokens onto the battlefield with "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game."

cards.name: Wayfaring Temple
cards.text:
Wayfaring Temple's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
Whenever Wayfaring Temple deals combat damage to a player, populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

cards.name: Wild Beastmaster
cards.text: Whenever Wild Beastmaster attacks, each other creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Wild Beastmaster's power.
cards.flavor: "When they covered the world in city, all they did was give themselves nowhere to run."

cards.name: Worldspine Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Worldspine Wurm dies, put three 5/5 green Wurm creature tokens with trample onto the battlefield.
When Worldspine Wurm is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.name: Zanikev Locust
cards.text:
Flying
Scavenge {2}{B}{B} ({2}{B}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
